  • Element
io.artframework.annotations

Annotation Type ArtModule


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface ArtModule
    This annotation marks the given class as an art module and provides additional meta data for it.

    You can then mark individual methods in the module class with one of the following annotations:

    • @OnLoad - the load method is called when the module is loaded and before it is enabled. It also takes an optional config class to load config data from a file.
    • @OnEnable - the enable method is called when the module gets enabled and all dependencies are resolved.
    • @OnDisable - the disable method is called when the module is disabled and unloaded. A module may be disabled and enabled multiple times in a lifecycle - acting as a reload.

    It is highly recommended that every module provides a description and a prefix that is used for all ART. You can optionally provide a version if you added features or fixed bugs in your module.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      java.lang.String value
      An unique identifier of your module.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String[] depends
      A list of identifiers or plugins your module depends on.
      java.lang.String[] description
      Optionally provide a detailed description about what your art module does.
      java.lang.String[] packages
      A list of packages that should be scanned for art classes.
      java.lang.String prefix
      An optional prefix that is applied to all art objects that are found inside this module.
      java.lang.String version
      The version of your ART module.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract java.lang.String value
        An unique identifier of your module.

        Defaults to the package name the annotated module class.

        Returns:
        the unique identifier of this module

      • prefix

        public abstract java.lang.String prefix
        An optional prefix that is applied to all art objects that are found inside this module.

        This is useful if you want to prefix all of your ART with your plugin name for example.

        Returns:
        the prefix used for all art objects found in this module
        Default:
        ""

      • packages

        public abstract java.lang.String[] packages
        A list of packages that should be scanned for art classes.

        By default all packages defined in this array will be scanned recusivly. And if the array is empty the package of the module class will be used as the base package.

        Returns:
        a list of packages to be scanned for art classes
        Default:
        {}

      • description

        public abstract java.lang.String[] description
        Optionally provide a detailed description about what your art module does. This helps users of your ART when looking for a module they need.
        Returns:
        detailed description of the module
        Default:
        {}

      • version

        public abstract java.lang.String version
        The version of your ART module.

        This is completely optional, but can help your users in understading new features and breaking changes of your module.

        You should use the semantic versioning schema to version your ART: https://semver.org/ This means bumping the major version for every breaking change.

        Returns:
        the optional version of the module. Defaults to 1.0.0.
        Default:
        "1.0.0"

      • depends

        public abstract java.lang.String[] depends
        A list of identifiers or plugins your module depends on.

        Make sure you prefix your dependencies with 'module:' or 'plugin:' to differentiate between the different dependency types. The best match will be used if no prefix for the dependency is found.

        Here is an example of a module that depends on the Vault plugin and on the art-commons module. 

        {@code
        Returns:
        a list of dependencies
        Default:
        {}
